newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan President to invest T$10bln in holding firm.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan President to invest T$10bln in holding firm.

text.p: Food giant President Enterprise Corp said on Thursday it would invest at least T$10 billion to establish a holding firm.
"We decided to set up the firm to help supervise and coordinate our various investment activities in Taiwan," a company spokeswoman told Reuters by telephone.
President, Taiwan's top investor in rival China, currently has 56 affiliated companies in land development, food processing, financial services, entertainment business, pharmacy and other industries.
"Investment in high-technology and large shopping malls will be the priority of the holding firm's work area," the spokeswoman said.
Officials said the corporation planned to complete fund-raising for the holding firm at the end of August, and President's chairman Kao Chin-yen would head the firm.
